title: WIT: Targeting System
description: WTS is a Blueprint based targeting mechanics starter system
longDescription:
WTS is a sub-module of the World Interaction Toolkit (WITv1) mechanics library. It is designed for rapid prototyping, and to be easily integrated into new or existing projects. Using WTS, you can quickly add targeting and tagging capabilities to your project. All Blueprints are well commented.


Easily switch between different targeting system implementations: Boundary based, and AI Perception based.


Documentation:

  • Quickstart Video
  • Quickstart Guide
  • Glossary
  • Additional documentation included in the project folder under Documentation/



Contents/Features

  • Boundary Based Targeting: Light-weight targeting implementation which uses a boundary to track valid targets in range
  • AI Perception Targeting: Leverage AI perception to track valid targets with sight sensing
  • Target Tagging/Highlighting: A tagging system to highlight and track targets
  • Icon label: Display object titles/names, with an action input.
technicalDetails:
Total Number of Blueprints: 10

Key Blueprints:

  • BP_TargetSystemActor
  • BP_TargetableActor


Supported Development Platforms: Developed on Windows

Documentation: Documentation within Blueprints. Official documentation coming soon.




Important/Additional Notes:


DISCLAIMER: WIT is a Blueprint mechanics library, and as such does not contain any art or animations. Any art or animations contained in related media (screenshots, video tutorials, etc.) are for demonstration purposes only.


WIT Sub-module Disclaimer: The components of the World Interaction Toolkit were developed to be easily integrated together. Because of this, many of the blueprints are shared. In order to reduce confusion, logic that is not related to this module has been removed from shared components. Visit WIT's documentation to see additional features contained in the library. You may purchase additional module offerings to extend functionality, or purchase the full WIT package (coming soon) which contains all components in one project.
